headline.main: SHIP BAN BALLOT IS SOUGHT TODAY; Isolationist Decide Against Filibuster on Repeal and Barkley Plans Vote 53 CLAIMED FOR PASSAGE Wheeler, in 4-Hour Speech, Denies Reich Menaces U.S., Sees Move Into War

lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, Nov. 6 -- Administration leaders in Congress, confident they have enough support to win, called on the opposition today to stop talking and vote tomorrow to arm American merchant ships and send them all over the world.
snippet: WASHINGTON, Nov. 6 -- Administration leaders in Congress, confident they have enough support to win, called on the opposition today to stop talking and vote tomorrow to arm American merchant ships and send them all over the world....

byline.original: By JAMES B. RESTONSpecial to THE NEW YORK TIMES
